oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Grand Ole Opry - Prince Albert - 1957-01-19 - Part 1
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Part 1 of Prince Albert tobacco sponsored Grand Ole Opry segment from January 19, 1957. Featuring Grant Turner (announcer), Hank Snow (host/performer), guest performers Bill Carlisle and the Carlisles, and regular performers the Old Hickory Quartet, Chubby Wise, Chet Atkins, Minnie Pearl, and Grandpa Jones. It is mentioned that Rod Brasfield is in hospital. Held at Ryman Auditorium, Nashville, TN.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Hank Snow; Old Hickory Quartet; Carlisles; Chubby Wise; Chet Atkins; Minnie Pearl
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: Grant Turner introduces Hank Snow -- Would You Mind (Hank Snow) -- Opening statement (Grant Turner, Hank Snow) -- Hank Snow introduces the Old Hickory Quartet -- Tuck Me To Sleep In My Old Kentucky Home (Old Hickory Quartet) -- Hank Snow introduces the Carlisles -- Business Man (Carlisles) -- Prince Albert commercial (Hank Snow, Grandpa Jones) -- Hank Snow introduces Chubby Wise -- Katy Hill (Chubby Wise calls) -- Hank Snow talks -- Invisible Hands (Hank Snow) -- Hank Snow introduces Chet Atkins -- Trambone (Chet Atkins) -- Hank Snow introduces Minnie Pearl -- Comedy routine (Minnie Pearl) [continued in part 2]
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: WSM (Radio station : Nashville, Tenn.); National Broadcasting Company; Grand ole opry (Radio program); Turner, Grant; Minnie Pearl; Atkins, Chet; Jones, Grandpa, 1913-1998; Old Hickory Singers; Wise, Chubby; Carlisle, Bill; Carlisles (Musical group); Snow, Hank
